intro: Pseudixora javanica, commonly known as the Javan pseudixora, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
